intro: Randia laevigata, commonly known as the smooth randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually smooth and glossy. It produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, followed by orange or red berries. Randia laevigata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
